item.title: Beginners
item.description:
1

Welcome to our beginners learn page. Here you can find material, links and articles to start you R journey.

R Introduction

An introduction to R with hands on examples and exercises can be found in Introduction to R.

There is also this Cheat Sheet: Base R to get an Overview for all basic functions in R.

item.title: R-SIG
item.description:
In the “R Special Interest Group” (R-SIG) we talk about all kinds of topics related to coding in R. It takes place every other week, so drop by if you’re interested!

Structure

Each session will focus on a specific topic/exercise, with a little input in the beginning, and a longer exercise part afterwards.

You also have the opportunity to bring in R-related questions which we will discuss in the end for 10 - 15 minutes. Please send them in the Friday before the next session.

A suggestion for a timetable we can loosely follow:

  • 13:00 - 13:15: Input
  • 13:15 - 13:35: Exercise time :)
  • 13:35 - 13:50: Discuss exercises
  • 13:50 - 14:10: Questions

Future Topics

Here a list of possible topics for the next sessions.

Date Title Author Reading Time
Oct 2, 2025 Regular expressions Nicklas Hafiz 5 min
Sep 9, 2024 Reproducible manuscripts with Git Nicklas Hafiz 6 min
Jul 15, 2024 Reproducible manuscripts with Quarto Nicklas Hafiz 14 min
Jun 3, 2024 Plotting with ggplot2 Nicklas Hafiz 1 min
Apr 8, 2024 Column-wise operations in the tidyverse Nicklas Hafiz 6 min
Mar 25, 2024 Data wrangling in the tidyverse Nicklas Hafiz 12 min
Mar 22, 2024 Data sets Nicklas Hafiz 2 min
Feb 26, 2024 Introduction to the tidyverse Nicklas Hafiz 7 min
Dec 18, 2023 Case_when() function Nicklas Hafiz 5 min
Oct 23, 2023 Reproducibility with renv Nicklas Hafiz 3 min
Oct 9, 2023 Cleaner Scripts Nicklas Hafiz 2 min
Jul 31, 2023 The apply family Nicklas Hafiz 4 min
Mar 20, 2023 for-loops Nicklas Hafiz 1 min
No matching items

item.title: Statistical Questions
item.description:
Welcome to our questions learn page. Here you can find articles about common questions regarding statistics or our IQB internal eat-packages.

Articles and Workshops

Frage 1: richtig poolen

statistics
eatRep
Wie poole ich mein richtig über mehrere (bspw. 15) Imputationen?

Sebastian Weirich

Frage 2: ‘estDif’ in Conquest/eatModel

statistics
eatModel
DIF-Richtung in Conquest/eatModel: Was bedeuten negative Werte in der “estDif”-Spalte?

Karoline Sachse

Frage 3: Gesamt- vs. Gruppenmittelwert in Mehrebenenmodellen

statistics
Zentrierung um den Gesamtmittelwert (Grand-Mean-Centering) oder um den Gruppenmittelwert (Group-Mean-Centering) und Bedeutung für Interaktionen in Mehrebenenmodellen

Karoline Sachse

Frage 4: N pro Item

statistics
Wie groß sollte das N pro Item idealerweise sein?

Sebastian Weirich
No matching items
